subject: senior research engineer in robotics  for advanced manufacturing - (tecnalia, san sebastian,  spain )
content: (apologies for multiple postings) in tecnalia's robotics group, we are looking for a robotics researcher/engineer with a strong software development background to develop and implement advanced robotic systems. tecnalia is the largest private, non-profit, technological research & development center in  spain  and one of the leading ones in europe. one of the main targets of any project in tecnalia is to development technology, mature it and transfer it to industrial companies, making sure that the r&d has a real impact! the advanced manufacturing business unit, within the industry and transport division, has 3 main focuses related to the field of robotics (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__tecnalia.com_robotics&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-vzjiwbd0p_hjvuzllrrxfmkcji7bmiioh9dkvxoito&s=9glp44ovihfu5lsgsd_wx2jrsvas0cm9hsocx-jeeze&e=  ): <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__tecnalia.com_robotics&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-vzjiwbd0p_hjvuzllrrxfmkcji7bmiioh9dkvxoito&s=9glp44ovihfu5lsgsd_wx2jrsvas0cm9hsocx-jeeze&e= > -        design and prototyping of innovative robots, as a product (pkm; cable-based robots, mobile robots..) -        robot autonomy for flexible manufacturing (3d vision, advanced manipulation, mobile manipulator, dual-arm robots, autonomous navigation...) -        robots for industrial processes automation (composite manufacturing, assembly, aeronautic drilling and assembly...) the position: we are looking for a robotics researcher/engineer with a strong software development background to develop and implement advanced robotic systems, working on projects related mainly (but not only) to robotics advanced manipulation, 3d vision robot guiding, mobile manipulators, automatic programming etc... the position is of a researcher/engineer within a private research center, thus including participation to the identification of new business opportunities, unexpressed requirements from our clients as well as definition and cost evaluation of the solution proposed in commercial offers, and contributions to european projects proposals. who are you? autonomous and dedicated, you have an innovative spirit and you are eager to move next generation robotics to real world applications, working on the robotics software development (manipulation, vision, mecatronics, real-time) and deployment of such innovative robotic systems, from the first conceptual ideas to the validation in real-condition pilot prototypes. you have proven knowledge of software programming, robotics system simulation and control. you have very good communication (oral and written) skills, are problem-solving oriented and you are comfortable with teamwork, in different languages and locations. requirements: -        phd or master degree in robotics, or industrial engineer with strong experience in r&d robotics projects. -        desired 5 years of experience in r&d in robotics. -        proven skills in software programming ( c/c++, python, continuous integration) and robotics software (ros, opencv, pcl...). -        fluency in english. eager to learn spanish quickly. french is welcome. -        availability for travels is required. desired: -        hands-on experience of 3d vision for robotics. -        applied knowledge of robot modeling, motion generation and robot/vision calibration. -        capability to understand and analyze scientific publications and patents. -        experience in private funded projects with fixed deadlines and resources. -        experience in the definition of r&d projects. will also be positively valued: -        experience of traditional robotics software is welcome (delmia, kuka, fanuc, abb...) -        experience in industrial control (plc, industrial robot controllers...). -        participation in collaborative projects such as european projects submit your cv! : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2q9fsjb&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-vzjiwbd0p_hjvuzllrrxfmkcji7bmiioh9dkvxoito&s=kwfugwxz6nn1lyjwhj3ohs6wezpxqxsrj7qz_vuj0se&e=  * the registration form is in spanish. ________________________________ dr. damien sall? division de industria y transporte - responsable del grupo rob?tica para fabricacion avanzada division industry and transports - head of the robotics group for advanced manufacturing www.tecnalia.com/robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.tecnalia.com_robotics&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-vzjiwbd0p_hjvuzllrrxfmkcji7bmiioh9dkvxoito&s=zpp21d_u-pjbeustozmgrt_2njqsn8dlrh_iw4ovsvq&e= > email: damien.salle at tecnalia.com<mailto:damien.salle at tecnalia.com> tecnalia paseo mikeletegi 7 - parque tecnol?gico e-20009 donostia - san sebasti?n telf movil: +34 667 119 720 telf: industry & transport division: (+34) 902 760 002 telf: tecnalia research & innovation: (+34) 902 760 000 fax: (+34) 901 706 009 web: www.tecnalia.com<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.tecnalia.com_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-vzjiwbd0p_hjvuzllrrxfmkcji7bmiioh9dkvxoito&s=0_9tkfzpofak0suprahgpndirylro4vmawumblgfgkg&e= > este mensaje puede contener informaci?n confidencial o privilegiada. si no eres el destinatario de este mensaje, notif?caselo por favor al remitente y b?rralo sin reenviarlo o guardarlo dado que est? legalmente prohibido. mezu honek daukan informazioa isilpekoa edo pribilegiatua izan daiteke. zuri zuzendua ez badago emaiozu, mesedez,  horren berri igorleari eta ezaba ezazu bidali edo gorde gabe, legalki debekatua dago eta. this message may contain confidential, proprietary or legally privileged information. if you are not the intended recipient of this message, please notify it to the sender and delete without resending or backing it, as it is legally prohibited.

subject: phd position in humanoid perception for  manipulation at jaume i university,  spain
content: call for a phd position in humanoid perception for manipulation at jaume i university (uji),  spain  ----------------------- the uji robotic intelligence laboratory (robinlab) (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robinlab.uji.es&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vdsgt-aedzdkteu82zwk0pks8ecqo4ho2rftp9fb4zm&s=lt0fds759ue7-3u1trzzmrvvghlsuyk8btbeu7cj9hu&e= ) offers a phd programme through the uji school for doctoral studies. one fully funded 3-year sponsored phd is available in castellon starting october 1, 2017 on the topic of perception for robotic manipulation in real-world applications.  deadline is july 15, 2017. research project ----------------------- the candidate will join the vibrant team of the project robopicker, led by prof. angel p. del pobil, and will be funded through the santiago grisolia program of valencia regional government, that only grants these studentships to the best selected projects. the overall objective of the project is to attain a breakthough in full human-like robotic manipulation in real-world situations. for the project we take inspiration from the amazon robotic challenge ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.amazonrobotics.com_-23_roboticschallenge&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vdsgt-aedzdkteu82zwk0pks8ecqo4ho2rftp9fb4zm&s=t_bye6_xptqph9x23-n8tmlfi1bmittggpcfyd4ectk&e= ), in which robinlab participates in 2017. reasons for the difficulty of this challenge arise from the fact that manipulation is conducted in a real environment, with several objects inside a restricted space, with poor visibility, accessibility, maneuverability and manipulability. also, the objects involved are ordinary items of disparate forms and sizes. in this context, the successful candidate will be expected to pursue his/her own research goals, according to his/her background and interests, among the different topics involved in the project, namely: object recognition, pose recognition, vision for grasp planning, sensor-based compliant manipulation, multimodal task execution, error detection and recovery, etc. bio-inspired approaches pertaining to active perception and multimodal sensorimotor coordination will be encouraged. the research work will be carried out on two humanoid platforms: uji's tombatossals humanoid torso and re-think robotics baxter, mounted on a mobile base. requirements ------------------- this studentship is intended for brilliant young graduates with outstanding performance, and fulfilling the requirements for admission to a phd programme, typically holding a master degree in computer vision, robotics, mechatronics, or a related discipline relevant to the project. an additional background and/or interest in computational neuroscience or interdisciplinary bio-inspired research will be a plus. excellent programming skills are essential along with the ability to develop software on robots (including ros). the ideal candidate should be self?motivated with good writing and communication skills in english. employment ----------------- we offer a very challenging full-time position for 3 years in an inspiring multidisciplinary and international environment. we also provide excellent facilities for professional and personal development, holiday allowances and a number of additional benefits. your main responsibility will be to carry out research, but you will be offered the opportunity to acquire some teaching experience as well. successful applicants will be awarded an annual bursary of 22,192 euros which amounts to a minimum annual gross salary of 16,800 ?, after deducting social costs, plus 1600 ? for travel expenses the first year. students are expected to complete their phd dissertation within the three year period. the expected start date is october 1, 2017 but a delay of no more than two months can be granted if necessary. application --------------- eligibility.- additional requirements. the candidate should: 1- hold an undergraduate academic degree (bsc), or equivalent in your country, in engineering, computer science or a related scientific field, by a non-spanish institution, and have finished these studies in the period from 01/30/2014 to 01/30/2017. 2 -  hold the master degree required for admission to the phd programme at the date the contract will be signed, i.e. november 1, 2017 at the latest. 3- possess a knowledge of spanish or english, at the level of conversation, suitable for the development of the research work. 4- not be in possession of a phd degree 5- not having obtained a scholarship from the santiago grisolia program before applications should include: a)    cover letter with personal data (nationality, date of birth, gender, current address) b)    copy of valid passport or  spain  resident card c)    official academic transcript including the name of obtained degrees (both msc and bsc), showing courses taken and grades achieved together with dates, as well as the maximum and minimum scores and score required for passing a course. an official translation into english or spanish is required if the original is in another language (french, italian or german are acceptable) d)    a detailed cv in english or spanish. e)    proof of adequate knowledge of english or spanish f)    names of two references or recommendation letters. the candidate should submit the above documents to <robinlab at uji.es> as soon as possible but no later than      >>>>>>   july 15, 2017 <<<<<< please include the above documents as a single pdf file with your name and include - ?phd application? in the subject-line. please meet this deadline, even if you do not have all the documents, since missing files can be provided later. for more information, please address your inquiries to prof. angel p. del pobil at <robinlab at uji.es> about uji robinlab --------------- robinlab has 25 years experience in rtd activities and a strong record of participation in funded european, national and regional projects, as well as with companies and private foundations. robinlab has a strong research line in robotics that was initiated in 1991 and today involves a team of 7 full-time researchers, who are also involved in the erasmus mundus master programme in advanced robotics. their activities emphasize research and development in the areas of cognitive and service robotics, including motion planning, active learning, multisensory grasping and manipulation, control architectures, neuro-robotics, visual and tactile perception, social and developmental robotics. the group has been very active in benchmarks and performance evaluation in robotics research. robinlab has participated in various european funded projects such as guardians, eyeshots and grasp. it has established itself as a renowned and highly competitive research organization within the robotics community, being one of the founding members of the euron network of excellence. robinlab offers a multidisciplinary and international environment, currently with students from 8 different nationalities. it is one of the 16 teams selected to compete at the amazon robotics challenge to be held in nagoya with robocup 2017. jaume i university is situated in castellon, a city on the mediterranean coast of  spain  between valencia and barcelona, it seeks to maintain a principle of open competition (on the basis of merit) to appoint the best candidate, and provides equal opportunity for all candidates, and equally encourage both genders to apply, as well as candidates with disabilities. professional perspectives --------------- professional perspectives for our students are excellent. former uji robinlab phd alumni include winners and finalists of the european phd george giralt award and robotdalen scientific award, as well as recipients of marie curie fellowships. they followed their careers as postdocs at prestigious universities such as the imperial college london, university of leeds, university of hertfordshire, university of plymouth, hong kong university of technology, or companies such as willow garage. books based on their thesis and subsequent work have been published by springer in series such as star or cosmos. currently they pursue their professional careers at companies such as google in california, intel in portland, the shadow robot company, or with academic positions at radboud university in the netherlands or middlesex university (u.k.) __________________________________________________________ angel p. del pobil professor - department of engineering and computer science director - robotic intelligence laboratory universitat jaume-i campus riu sec, edificio ti e-12071 castellon  spain  skype: apobil email: <robinlab at uji.es> tel: +34-964-72.82.94 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robinlab.uji.es&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vdsgt-aedzdkteu82zwk0pks8ecqo4ho2rftp9fb4zm&s=lt0fds759ue7-3u1trzzmrvvghlsuyk8btbeu7cj9hu&e=  __________________________________________________________

subject: phd position in emotions and human  motion (yael edan)
content: ph.d. position in emotions and human motion department of industrial engineering and management agricultural, biological, cognitive robotics initiative ben-gurion university of the negev, israel research topic: effects of people?s emotional state on their body motion this research project aims to examine the effects of people?s emotional state on their body motion. based on data generated in lab experiments using a motion capture system, we will investigate the relation between people's emotional state and their body motion and will develop models and algorithms for emotion recognition based on human motion. such models may be used to develop robots that express emotion in their motion and/or devices that can recognize people?s emotional state by monitoring their motions. the project combines data acquisition of motion data, theoretical work, and implementation work. this is an interdisciplinary project conducted in collaboration with researchers from engineering and from behavioral sciences. the research team is led by dr. raziel riemer who specializes in biomechanics research and dr. hila riemer who specializes in research on emotions across cultures. requirements the applicant for this position must have completed an m.sc. or m.a. thesis in engineering, computer sciences, psychology, biomechanics, or cognitive sciences. the applicant must be skilled in both oral and written communication in english, can work independently as well as in collaboration with others. we are looking for candidates with strong technical and programming skills. experience in traditional biomechanics and motor control research techniques, such as motion capture, force measurement, electromyography, programming (matlab/c++/python), and statistics are merits. candidates should have interest in understanding human behavior (although should not necessarily have background in such topics) and be passionate about learning and developing knowledge in a novel and exciting area. ben-gurion university of the negev ben-gurion university (bgu) is an internationally recognized research university that attracts outstanding faculty and researchers from around the world with over 19,000 students. advance innovative multidisciplinary robotics research at bgu is conducted under the auspices of the abc robotics initiative (www.bgu.ac.il/abc-robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il_abc-2drobotics&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=kuoov2zrlb6u4sorjfm9bmjm1s4dg8ebgycsj_d-lzk&e= >). socrates the recruitment is done as part of socrates (social cognitive robotic agents in the european society), a new marie sk?odowska-curie european training network (etn) comprising 7 universities/research institutes: ume? university and ?rebro university in  sweden , universit?t hamburg and fraunhofer ipa, stuttgart in germany, csic barcelona in  spain , university west of england, and ben-gurion university of the negev in israel. additional non-academic partners are: pal robotics, adele robots, alfred nobel science park, urquhart-dykes & lord llp, center for digital innovation, uminova, asea brown boveri, s.a, and fundaci? ace. about the position the research will be conducted at bgu (israel) with some training in germany (universit?t hamburg and fraunhofer ipa, stuttgart in germany). the successful applicant will devote full time for research and will receive a competitive salary for a period of three years, provided that expected study and research results are achieved. no teaching is expected. the salary will be based on the standard marie sk?odowska-curie early-stage researcher living and mobility allowances. expected starting date is september 2017, or as soon as possible after this date. once approved by bgu?s socrates graduate committee, the student must be accepted to bgu?s graduate school (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__in.bgu.ac.il_en_kreitman-5fschool_pages_admission.aspx&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=wj4kh1nh1qju-ksw89unqqgvoq_erecx77pam3zgtgs&e= ) and obtain a visa and working permit according to the ministry of interior requirements. the candidate must submit a research proposal and go through a qualification exam within one year of studies on his/her research proposal. to promote mobility, the following rule applies: at the time of recruitment, the applicants must not have resided or carried out their main activity in israel for more than 12 months during the last 3 years. compulsory national service, work in international organizations, and short stays such as holidays are not taken into account. the applicants must not, at the time of recruitment, have spent more than 4 years doing research, and must not have been awarded a doctoral degree. application a complete application should contain the following documents: ? a cover letter including a description of your research interests, your goals in applying for the position (how would this position fit with your goals), and your contact information. ? a curriculum vitae. ? copies of degree certificates, including documentation of completed academic courses and obtained grades. ? copy of completed msc or ma thesis and other original research publications. ? contact information of three people willing to serve as references (including your msc/ma thesis advisor). ? documentation of programming skills and software development experience. applications should be submitted electronically by email no later than august 1, 2017, to the following address: socrates at post.bgu.ac.il<mailto:socrates at post.bgu.ac.il>. for more information about the project and position please contact socrates at post.bgu.ac.il<mailto:socrates at post.bgu.ac.il> www.socrates-project.eu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.socrates-2dproject.eu&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=jotxlmeaboxdj1fu3bareznvlsqhs9tqht83ndc1vqw&e= > www.bgu.ac.il<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=jwwn2u68qgxu6bqsk3p_tznah6vfqlchim0xdsimvpu&e= > www.bgu.ac.il/abc-robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il_abc-2drobotics&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=kuoov2zrlb6u4sorjfm9bmjm1s4dg8ebgycsj_d-lzk&e= > https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il_-7erriemer_&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zjvfv5fjuhm6gxx9kegv1dh0dig1bwt-ovnzjmxtxuk&s=6uh6aa6fa8sgd8sy52ldd6xht3sqtotof-wouyqlhmy&e=  applications will be accepted until the position is filled

subject: test engineer in robotics software  development at omron industrial automation
content: dear all, we have an open permanent position for a 'test engineer in robotics software development'. the position is to join the mdt team that is placed in barcelona ( spain ). the mdt is a small innovation & development team that is part of the world-wide robotics development group, other teams are in california (us) and kusatsu (japan). as part of the group we are responsible of the software/firmware development of omron robotics products. and we are looking for a person that would enjoy:     - team work: working in the team and encouraging each other towards our goals;     - business involvement: analyzing requirements and getting them right, supporting colleagues and customers with your expertise;     - testing: developing a test strategy that targets risks based on deep understanding of the system under development and its usage, developing test environment and maximizing test automation, creating tests by focusing on customer usage (over technical implementation) and uncovering flaws (over confirming completeness), making sure that your tests will catch errors if they occur, analyzing and documenting problems, helping developers to reproduce and solve them, reporting testing progress and providing information about the status of product under development to inform decisions (including decision to release the product);     - kaizen: looking constantly for personal and team improvement and helping to bring this team to a higher level, especially in testing process and tools. desired skills and experience:     - university degree in computer science, electronics, industrial automation or similar;     - minimal of two years experience in a similar job;     - passionate for industrial automation and for system testing, wish to make the next career step towards testing of embedded robotics control systems;     - have good programming skills in one or more programming languages like c++, c#, .net, matlab;     - have a good level of english, both spoken and written;     - have experience with automating system tests is preferred;     - have experience in motion and robotics applications and plc programming is preferred;     - have knowledge of embedded software systems is preferred;     - experience with agile software development methods is preferred;     - like both formal and informal communications;     - have an ambition to learn and grow within our organization;     - like a challenge and take the lead in his or her field of expertise;     - feel comfortable in an international environment. more information about the position in:         https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.linkedin.com_jobs_view_342320582_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mxy8z6ifmwhzy0kyrmvpde1zveobp91pty08l5sp0ji&s=q_7girqs2dcgctdk_ak81p4c1eqnhgzvnurwf089iag&e=  kind regards, -- diego escudero https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.linkedin.com_in_dgerod&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mxy8z6ifmwhzy0kyrmvpde1zveobp91pty08l5sp0ji&s=ixasi-q59tmzu6z8vsvkfbaqfl_nk2lrjng03wlmay8&e=

subject: 2 phd student positions at iri, csic-upc,   spain
content: *==========================================================================================  ** **2 phd student positions at iri, csic-upc,  spain  *_application deadline: 10/10/2017_* ==========================================================================================  * iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking outstanding candidates for  2 phd student positions: - position (1): phd student - robot-human collaboration - position (2):? phd student - efficiency and durability optimisation of  energy management systems designed for mobile robotic applications, *about iri:* the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial  (iri),<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ego5qgdyyrc40zcy9eenq-bujlhpd4x8glowbc8-2vm&s=ocn8bs7t-ulixjf532uhz1bq0znjw5wrkc6wcatrafw&e=>is a joint university research institute  participated by the spanish council for scientific research (csic) and  the technical university of catalonia (upc) that conducts research in  human-centered robotics and automatic control. the institute, is a key  player in the spanish robotics and automatic control scenes, and a  valued participant in a large number of international collaborations  including more than ten ongoing h2020? projects and an erc advanced  grant.recently, is has been recognized as a maria de maeztu excellence  unit, the main accreditation given by the spanish government to research  units that stand out for the impact and international relevance of their  results. * **position (1)* the phd student will work on the project "colrobtransp", whose main  objective is to advance in the design of new mobile robots that are  capable to transport products in the last mile of urban areas,  overcoming with the help of humans complex situations in navigation and  product delivery. not only navigation in urban crowded areas is complex,  but also it is important how the robots overcome complex street  situations, for example, streets semi-blocked due to street repairing or  vehicles not well parked that do not allow to reach the delivery place. the phd thesis will be directed by prof. alberto sanfeliu. more info:? https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_45&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ego5qgdyyrc40zcy9eenq-bujlhpd4x8glowbc8-2vm&s=y51_wk_u3yfu50m-ou1lnb9dafqcgdbaq9ehqwypcnk&e= *position (2)* the phd student will work under the framework of the mar?a de maeztu  (mdm) unit of excellence seal. the thesis project will consist of the  development of automatic control methodologies to improve the  performance and durability of pem fuel cell systems, applied to mobile  social or healthcare robots as their main power supply. the objective of  the phd student is to design new high-level and low-level control  systems that solve the main challenges to these types of energy  conversion devices: the increase of energy efficiency and of useful life  while outperforming the state of the art energy supply systems in terms  of energy density (autonomy). the thesis will be directed by dr. attila husar and co-directed by dr.  juan andrade. more info:? https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_48&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ego5qgdyyrc40zcy9eenq-bujlhpd4x8glowbc8-2vm&s=qoqsjnoh1cu3yiepaal7637qm3zm8ffmldik2lqiwi4&e= *about the positions:* both positions will be fully covered by an fpi grant with a duration of  4 years under the spanish government call "ayudas para contratos  predoctorales para la formaci?n de doctores 2017". the candidates are expected to start the first semester of 2018. official applications for these positions must be made at spanish  ministry webpage  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.idi.mineco.gob.es_portal_site_micinn_menuitem.dbc68b34d11ccbd5d52ffeb801432ea0_-3fvgnextoid-3db96552ab45a7e510vgnvcm1000001d04140arcrd&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ego5qgdyyrc40zcy9eenq-bujlhpd4x8glowbc8-2vm&s=w_go4ai7ywvdbyxzkmeyshq5oxsiqj_14csybwydvnc&e=>  before 18th october 2017 (site in spanish). however, in order to help you and to get to know you during the  application process, please contact with us as soon as possible and no  later than the*10th october 2017*, sending your cv to: jobs (at) iri.upc.edu we are looking forward to receiving your application. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83 @iri_robotics --

subject: phd position ioc-upc, barcelona,  spain
content: ----------------------------------------- open phd student position ----------------------------------------- where:  ioc-upc,  institute of industrial and control engineering                                  universitat politecnica de catalunya                                  barcelona,  spain  when:  application period from 03/10/2017 to 18/10/2017 duration:  four years (starting 2018) financial support:  spanish government (ayudas para contratos predoctorales para la formaci?n de doctores 2017). more information:  applications must be done at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.idi.mineco.gob.es_portal_site_micinn_menuitem.dbc68b34d11ccbd5d52ffeb801432ea0_-3fvgnextoid-3db96552ab45a7e510vgnvcm1000001d04140arcrd&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xvi6csseqmkojtlxbainvmghi2x35tix7h3ttql5kag&s=llxhxmh2v9zerpevxv0lsajpjykyxmrf2zt_lrmbxsa&e= requirements: - master's degree in engineering, computer science, robotics or a related discipline. welcome background: - knowledge of basic concepts in robotics. - programming skills and knowledge of c++ and ros - strong analytical skills and mathematical foundation. interested potential candidates are encouraged to contact as soon as possible with prof. jan rosell, email <jan.rosell at upc.edu> or with dr. raul suarez <raul.suarez at upc.edu> . the phd work will be developed in the frame of the research project   "autonomous dexterous robots as coworkers with human operators" (audeco), supported by the spanish government, reference dpi2016-80077-r (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iocnet.upc.edu_usuaris_raul.suarez_proyectos_audeco_audeco-2deng.html&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xvi6csseqmkojtlxbainvmghi2x35tix7h3ttql5kag&s=4krdo6vsjpel1bwqcdsvvzqetk_f87n6ixhletbgn_4&e=) summary of the research project: the robotics field-of-application is constantly growing as the technological advances allow new capabilities and an increment and strength of the already existing ones. among the new applications, it is worth mentioning, due to their potential significance from the productive and social point of view, those in which the robots work jointly with the humans, originating the concept of ?coworker robots?. in this type of applications, the robots require some special features. on the one hand, they must have certain level of autonomy and capacity of decision, as their role is no longer doing repetitive tasks in the classical way but on the contrary, they must adapt themselves with swiftness to changing conditions, especially to those produced by the humans in the same workspace. this adaptation implies an interaction with the human operators that constraint the robot movements and actions with the aim of avoiding potential injuries to humans, but without affecting the robot efficiency. in order for the coworker robots to be useful for the human operators, it is necessary that they have an important level of dexterity so that they can perform a number of different actions usually required in the human activities. in this context, the project aims for solutions that increment the performance of the coworker robots to allow their permanent establishment in our society, and, at the same time, facilitate their acceptance by the humans. with this aim, the project will deal with the topics mentioned above, developing algorithms and procedures that make easy the efficient cooperation between coworker robots and humans. specifically, contributions are expected in relevant topics, as: the increment of the robot capability to autonomously manage the required tasks and the movements to execute them, using ontologies to represent the knowledge; the increment of the dexterous and bimanual manipulation capabilities, monitoring the movements to prevent potential failures; and the improvement of the interaction with the human operators regarding reactive, cooperative and exchange-objects movements, considering approaches based on demonstrations or on teleoperation. all the theoretical developments will be checked and validated experimentally using the systems specifically prepared for it in the project. besides, as usual in the developments of the group, the mentioned problems will be addressed with the intention of providing general solutions, valid for both industrial and service robotics, taking care of the productive and social components. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=h9g_sitsoksgqhea8ciissnb_1kok-gpes4ze_kd9x0&s=lcp_zvlmsvnghkwsqiobjzheqj31u8dnwdkpvuoudru&e=

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal   topics: active and healthy ageing, ambient assistive living, social robots, smart homes, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction.  application deadline: november 3, 2017 (hard deadline)  --------------------------------------------------------------------  one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=nd-g_onb-ckdbppk15u-lv9v1il7jp7vtew0lfk7olk&s=a6tyn4cicsoqchlbsfekt3_jiljpexvbffyqp8hvnti&e=),  portugal , starting in december 2017, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020).  the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the aging of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project will demonstrate and validate with elderly people the use of social robots and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population.  the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, and must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in using computer vision libraries, including opencv, pcl (point cloud library) and openpr, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the euroage project.  application procedure  applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents:      1. i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate and certificates of other academic degrees held by the candidate (e.g. b.sc.);      2. ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation;  iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on the 4th december 2017.  the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents:  - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, computer vision, and pattern recognition;  - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects;  - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation.  applicants must include in the motivation letter a research statement and state their availability to start working at isr - university of coimbra on the 4th december 2017.  since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in early nov. 2017 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv.  the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in euroage project?, *no later than november 3, 2017*.  ______  rui p. rocha, ph.d.  assistant professor  institute of systems and robotics  dept. of electrical and computer engineering  university of coimbra  universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii  3030-290 coimbra,  portugal   e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc. tel.: +351 239 796 256  skype: rprocha  web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha  _______  founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them.  the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=nd-g_onb-ckdbppk15u-lv9v1il7jp7vtew0lfk7olk&s=2t2gmyblvdfpzwf7qajpaq3r8nvm4vijvg9qsxjasmq&e= ), mostly from europe.

subject: 4 phd student positions at iri, csic-upc,   spain
content: *==========================================================================================  ** **4 phd student positions at iri, csic-upc,  spain  * mar?a de maeztu project _application deadline: 20/11/2017_ *==========================================================================================  * iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking candidates for its "mar?a  de maeztu" strategic research programme. in particular, the following positions are available: - position (1): phd student - fractionary systems in mechanical and fuel  cell systems? [offer #50] - position (2): phd student - action planning and synchronization for  human-robot collaboration [offer #51] - position (3): phd student - supervision and control in human-centered  robots [offer #52] - position (4): phd student - human movement and action estimation for  robot-human collaboration? [offer #53] *about iri:* the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial  (iri),<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kajjp4qhfcf2705lktknvzt6yjpfdcvnxs7ztfijngc&s=rc21olzifzhsgmzzp1nrhr00hwmijnfg4o_oghobujo&e=>is a joint university research institute  participated by the spanish council for scientific research (csic) and  the technical university of catalonia (upc) that conducts research in  human-centered robotics and automatic control. the institute, is a key  player in the spanish robotics and automatic control scenes, and a  valued participant in a large number of international collaborations  including more than ten ongoing h2020? projects and an erc advanced  grant.recently, is has been recognized as a maria de maeztu excellence  unit, the main accreditation given by the spanish government to research  units that stand out for the impact and international relevance of their  results. *commons characteristics of these 4 positions:* all the phd positions are fully covered with a three-year contract  (extendable for a further year) under the "mar?a de maeztu" strategic  research programme. each position will include specific funding for enrolment fees, research  stays, training courses and other research expenses. starting date of the contracts: first trimester of 2018. *about position (1): **phd student - fractionary systems in mechanical  and fuel cell systems *_supervisors:_ dr. federico thomas and dr. ramon costa. _project:_ the thesis project will consist in the development of  fractionary based modeling and control methods. in recent times,  fractional mathematical and computational tools haven been developed so  that fractional calculus can be used to model and control many different  applications. currently there?s a bunch of new frameworks were these  tools are being used. in this thesis fractionary based modeling and  control methods will be developed having in mind two main applications  frameworks: fuel cell systems, and flexible and deformable mechanical  systems. **_more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_50&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kajjp4qhfcf2705lktknvzt6yjpfdcvnxs7ztfijngc&s=mfhfs7xawufftefjqgpn8srb-8xpt4ydi8x3ppx7o3i&e= ** about position (2): ***phd student - action planning and synchronization  for human-robot collaboration* ****_supervisors:_ dr. alberto sanfeliu and dr. pablo jim?nez ** _project:_ the collaboration between a robot and a person involves  knowing the tasks that each of them will perform, knowing how each one  will perform the task and find a shared common plan. for this reason, both the robot and the person create their own plan to  tackle the task. this plan has to be shared, readjusted and finally  executed by both of them. the objective of the thesis project is to develop a new model of task  planning, which allows to make a plan shared between the robot and the  person who is susceptible of modification, synchronization and inline  adaptation. **_more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_51&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kajjp4qhfcf2705lktknvzt6yjpfdcvnxs7ztfijngc&s=is-snb720puv6-31db9-l4_ixhmcislztefa3tkcslo&e= *about position (3): **phd student - supervision and control in  human-centered robot *_supervisors:_ dr. vicen? puig and dr. guillem aleny? _project: _ human-centered robotics is a challenging field that involves  complex dynamic systems. in this phd project, new supervision algorithms  will be developed that explicitly account for safety issues in the  context of bi-manual manipulation in social applications. learning and  planning algorithms will be used to continuously improve real-time  supervision rules and to identify critical issues. performance  considerations are mandatory as evaluation will be performed using  redundant mobile-manipulation robots **_more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_52&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kajjp4qhfcf2705lktknvzt6yjpfdcvnxs7ztfijngc&s=gvgbhyiok_lqbgyqqwv1elptyduofef60nvrucqn_v4&e= *about position (4): **phd student - human movement and action  estimation for robot-human collaboration *_supervisors:_ dr. francesc moreno and dr. alberto sanfeliu. _project: _ in order to perform collaborative tasks involving robots and  humans, the robot needs to predict the 3d motion and intentions of the  human person. based on deep learning techniques, this thesis proposal seeks to learn  from one or several sequences of positions which action the person is  going to do and which specific 3d body position will take. the images will be obtained directly from the mobile robots that is  interacting with the human or by means of an aerial robot that oversees  the whole sequence of operations. _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_53&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kajjp4qhfcf2705lktknvzt6yjpfdcvnxs7ztfijngc&s=9io1_-atnsm_mqyfwm6hlxhpi-e8qpxjykhjyxxjxbw&e= we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  v?ctor v?lchez garc?a tel: 93 401 57 83 institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc @iri_robotics --

subject: phd position in social robotics
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- phd position at  robolab - university of extremadura,  spain  topics: social navigation, localization, task planning deadline: november 20, 2017 -------------------------------------------------------------------- robolab, the robotics and artificial vision laboratory of the university of extremadura (www.robolab.unex.es)  is seeking a phd graduate to carry out research in the field of household robotics. the research will include topics such as social navigation and localization, machine perception, task planning, and hybrid approaches to knowledge representation. candidates must be familiar with c++ and python and have a strong robotics background. the robotics and artificial vision laboratory of the university of extremadura is located in c?ceres (extremadura,  spain ). the research group is composed by 6 researchers and engineers, as well as a significant number of student interns. the research group performs research in robotic and autonomous systems for different domains including household, assistive, and agricultural robots. informal enquiries may be addressed to dr pedro n??ez: <pnuntru at unex dot es> ------------------------------------------------------------------ dr. pedro m. n??ez trujillo subdirector tic e investigacion escuela polit?cnica, univ. de extremadura laboratorio de rob?tica y visi?n artificial https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robolab.unex.es&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lsbx9fcmy09oetgga0qflcbmfjdo3zbvgnwelwid-le&s=ycv0enywiz60s9vad411q-i1kaczrgfle3hiebnmv2w&e= phone: +34 927 257259 fax: +34 927 257203

subject: postdoc position on social robots for  domestic taks assistance
content: job title: postdoc position on social robots for domestic taks assistance dept. of computer engineering and maths school of engineering universitat rovira i virgili av. paisos catalans, 26 e-43007 tarragona,  spain  job overview: assistive personal robots will become more useful in our lives by interacting with and assisting human beings in tasks of everyday life, such as housekeeping and butler services. although many commercial products for home care assistance have been launched, their abilities are very limited due to being fully targeted at one specific task. thus, research on multitask robots has recently seen much progress. these robots operating in domestic environments (e.g., home settings) should be able, for example, to pick up and safely transport objects from one place to another, to draw, or care. to achieve such tasks, the robot needs to be able to identify and to recognise, as well as to grasp and manipulate different types of objects, in addition to cope with many challenges. interested candidates, please contact prof. domenec puig: domenec.puig at urv.cat<mailto:domenec.puig at urv.cat> -- _____________________________________________ prof. dr. domenec puig valls dept. of computer engineering and maths school of engineering universitat rovira i virgili av. paisos catalans, 26 e-43007 tarragona,  spain  tel.: +34 977559677 fax:  +34 977559710 e-mail: domenec.puig at urv.cat<mailto:domenec.puig at urv.cat> web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__deim.urv.cat_-7erivi_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ynz9e2hjwiy3bvlqeuqy69_r9qqh8ytmxwpzf3viux8&s=trgnmgsube70d68ikfcm6_sblrjmb8ah0o6miaxksfw&e= [urv] _____________________________________________

subject: phd position in lifelong visual slam -  bosch corporate research and university of zaragoza
content: ----------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------ 1 phd position available - lifelong visual slam ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ we have an unique opportunity to pursue doctoral research on visual slam, a relevant topic of academic and industrial interest; and acquire an excellent academic and industrial background from top actors in the field. the focus will be lifelong visual slam, with the aim of developing scene models that integrate the dynamics of typical scenarios, from visual data. the phd will be developed - partly in the slamlab (university of zaragoza,  spain ), pioneers and recognized experts in slam, authors of several of the most relevant slam papers, under my supervision - and partly in bosch corporate research (hildesheim, germany), in one of the biggest and most active computer vision groups in the european industrial sector. please, see more information and apply in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.bosch-2dcareer.de_en_bewerben_jobsearch_-2d_cui_job_&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g4maxtz_olz05ih1defevu_xtsqpguo3iu9ouos969m&s=mtvfivzt5r6q2pxinei2un4mbktzz_vzgtrubdlearg&e= zrb_unreg_search/en/567d863a01021ed7b58752dffc2c4786 ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ phd topic summary ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ visual slam (simultaneous localization and mapping) is one of the key technologies for robotics, autonomous driving, augmented- and virtual-reality. visual slam takes the images from a camera mounted on a moving platform, with the aim of estimating its ego-motion and a scene map from the video sequence. lifelong slam refers to the development of map models that capture long-term dynamics of the objects in natural scenes (e.g., changes in position of books on a desk, doors closing and opening, chairs that are moved). most of the current visual slam algorithms assume a rigid scene and cannot model such changes, limiting the temporal validity of the maps. thus, the core topic of the phd constitutes of the incorporation of such dynamic patterns to slam maps, which is one of the less explored research problems in the field. ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ job description ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ * research in the field of lifelong visual slam * develop and evaluate novel algorithms for visual slam * develop efficient computer vision algorithms and software * analysis of research community, cooperate with and contribute to the research in the host labs * publish scientific articles with the developed algorithms and results * attend scientific conferences and events to present your research results * prepare a doctoral thesis related with the research project ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ requirements ------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------ * very good master degree(s) in engineering, physics, robotics, computer science or a related field, with a solid background in machine learning and/or computer vision * excellent academic background * high personal initiative, independent and structured way of working * demonstrable programming skills, preferably c/c++, matlab and/or python * demonstrable practical experience and knowledge in machine learning, computer vision and/or visual slam * convincing appearance, high commitment combined with interpersonal skills in teams * fluent english, written and spoken, knowledge of academic english * german knowledge is an advantage --  javier civera jcivera[at]unizar[dot]es https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__webdiis.unizar.es_-7ejcivera&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=g4maxtz_olz05ih1defevu_xtsqpguo3iu9ouos969m&s=dt0s8cnesoq-y3xawa5ge6iy0uwsunjazf25og3ms-0&e= (+34) 876555554 departamento de informatica e ingenieria de sistemas universidad de zaragoza c/ maria de luna, 1 50018 zaragoza,  spain .

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) -------------------------------------------------------------------- research engineer position at isr - university of coimbra,  portugal  topics: active and healthy ageing, ambient assisted living, social robots, smart homes, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction. application deadline: january 22, 2018 (hard deadline) -------------------------------------------------------------------- one research engineer position is available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=0i9hc8mpbrhyttoogukosu2cg4zidac9eaocxenj6km&e=),  portugal , starting in february 2018, under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project will demonstrate and validate with elderly people the use of social robots and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the candidates must hold a m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science engineering, **obtained in a university located in a country that adhered to the european higher education area (a.k.a. bolonha declaration), in canada, or in usa**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. the ideal candidate would have excellent software development skills in c++ and linux os, solid experience in software development for robots using ros (robot operating system), experience in pattern recognition and machine learning techniques, excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, and be eager to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate and certificates of other academic degrees held by the candidate (e.g. b.sc.); ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate her/his total availability to start working in isr - university of coimbra on early february. important notice: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=q1vm3ponv-o3xj_fkum6x5wnsoojssw5nyiir9r8fo8&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, pattern recognition, machine learning, and computer vision; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the two applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in january 2018 before the winning candidate is selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]isr.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer position in euroage project?, *no later than january 22, 2018*. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]isr.uc./ rprocha[at]deec.uc./ rui.rocha[at]uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: home.deec.uc.pt/~rprocha _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec. the artificial perception for intelligent systems and robotics (ap4isr) team of isr-uc has participated in several ec-funded projects, both in fp6 (projects bacs and irps), fp7 (projects prometheus, handle, and social robot), and h2020 (project growmeup) framework programmes. the ap4isr team has been doing research in collaboration with important european players in excellence research from universities, research institutions, and companies (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ap.isr.uc.pt_-3fw-3dpartners&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=a9yxvauitrefqtclmutshtx1m-iwarh26ukb-i3ch6k&s=yct73ovcqhsrsqme1y6yr4eargibvhthuykbbt_tksk&e=), mostly from europe.

subject: research engineer position available at  isr - university of coimbra,   portugal  on active and healthy ageing and aal in general in-reply-to: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt> references: <1884206993.870263.1515502533675.javamail.zimbra@isr.uc.pt>

subject: postdoc position at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: *==========================================================================================  ** **1 postdoc***position* at iri, csic-upc,  spain  * _application deadline: 28/02/2018_ *==========================================================================================  * iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a postdoctoral researcher  to work under the framework of the "mar?a de maeztu (mdm)" unit of  excellence seal. in particular, the topic of the posdoc position is "*linking perception  and manipulation of non-rigid objects through deep learning*" *about iri:* the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), is a joint  university research institute participated by the spanish national  research council (csic) and the technical university of catalonia (upc)  that conducts research in human-centered robotics and automatic control.  the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics and automatic  control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number of  international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, it has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. *about the postdoc **position* the goal of this postdoc project is to develop novel learning techniques  to allow a non-expert user to easily teach a service robot to perform  complex manipulation tasks of non-rigid objects (such as clothes or  food) using a simple rgb-d camera as capturing hardware. the core  technique in our approach will be reinforcement learning (rl), which is  strongly mathematically grounded and has made tremendous progress  recently thanks to the integration of deep learning techniques. however,  by its trial-and-error nature, deep-rl cannot currently be applied  directly to complex task learning involving large state-spaces. for this  purpose, we will extend deep rl with new learning strategies exploiting  advanced perception algorithms on real data and combining them with  simulated data, obtained either from independent rendering engines or  from generative-adversarial networks.* * the candidate will be supervised by dr. carme torras  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_torras_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ccplhx2njhxnfhd1au9tq7vjmzrdau4h9weox54cd_c&s=rkuzhcixucoeq7p09-ijsv_shz5g_it_p0dbsen8310&e=> and dr. francesc moreno  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_fmoreno_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ccplhx2njhxnfhd1au9tq7vjmzrdau4h9weox54cd_c&s=usdjt79qx8fbbnxupqfndszywa2ytyj7lwg3jweetny&e=>, and she/he will work in  cooperation with the members of the perception and manipulation group at  iri. the candidate is expected to publish the results of his/her  research in top-tier conferences and journals of computer vision and  robotics.* * *about the position * a two-year postdoc position under the mdm strategic research programme  will be fully covered starting in the first trimester of 2018. the  salary will be around 36000 ? gross per year. in addition, 5500 ? per  year will be available for research expenses of the postdoc (travels,  registrations, equipment, training, etc) *requirements of the candidates* the candidate can be of any nationality. she/he should be a doctor with  a solid mathematical and computer science background. the candidate  should have experience in carrying out research in computer vision and  machine learning. expertise in visual detection and recognition of  deformable objects (in particular, clothing) will be especially valued,  as will the processing of rgb-d images, knowledge of deep learning  techniques, and some experience in robot manipulation. _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_56&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ccplhx2njhxnfhd1au9tq7vjmzrdau4h9weox54cd_c&s=ov7gs8c1apj9otyn2k_zz11oo0u3dlhe4fhnz9fbqh8&e= _application deadline:_ 28/02/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: postdoc position at iri, csic-upc,  spain  in-reply-to: <e57697ba-e1d7-66f2-b330-8991263eaf3f@iri.upc.edu> references: <e57697ba-e1d7-66f2-b330-8991263eaf3f@iri.upc.edu>
content: ==========================================================================================  1 postdocposition at iri, csic-upc,  spain  _application deadline: 28/02/2018_ ==========================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a postdoctoral researcher  to work under the framework of the "mar?a de maeztu (mdm)" unit of  excellence seal. in particular, the topic of the posdoc position is "linking perception  and manipulation of non-rigid objects through deep learning". about iri the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), is a joint  university research institute participated by the spanish national  research council (csic) and the technical university of catalonia (upc)  that conducts research in human-centered robotics and automatic control.  the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics and automatic  control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number of  international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, it has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about the postdoc position the goal of this postdoc project is to develop novel learning techniques  to allow a non-expert user to easily teach a service robot to perform  complex manipulation tasks of non-rigid objects (such as clothes or  food) using a simple rgb-d camera as capturing hardware. the core  technique in our approach will be reinforcement learning (rl), which is  strongly mathematically grounded and has made tremendous progress  recently thanks to the integration of deep learning techniques. however,  by its trial-and-error nature, deep-rl cannot currently be applied  directly to complex task learning involving large state-spaces. for this  purpose, we will extend deep rl with new learning strategies exploiting  advanced perception algorithms on real data and combining them with  simulated data, obtained either from independent rendering engines or  from generative-adversarial networks.* * the candidate will be supervised by dr. carme torras  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_torras_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uxm1lab_jw0f-ww9otmpy6mtyyezp0lciiu6b5nrff8&s=fod47d7qtodkonbnuq6jw5qufxpak_rbntm4u4h1wsi&e=> and dr. francesc moreno  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_fmoreno_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uxm1lab_jw0f-ww9otmpy6mtyyezp0lciiu6b5nrff8&s=d8iegf3haor793hu9wqrrg21qn_zc0fklasp9jdcs9i&e=>, and she/he will work in  cooperation with the members of the perception and manipulation group at  iri. the candidate is expected to publish the results of his/her  research in top-tier conferences and journals of computer vision and  robotics.* * about the position a two-year postdoc position under the mdm strategic research programme  will be fully covered starting in the first trimester of 2018. the  salary will be around 36000 ? gross per year. in addition, 5500 ? per  year will be available for research expenses of the postdoc (travels,  registrations, equipment, training, etc) requirements of the candidates the candidate can be of any nationality. she/he should be a doctor with  a solid mathematical and computer science background. the candidate  should have experience in carrying out research in computer vision and  machine learning. expertise in visual detection and recognition of  deformable objects (in particular, clothing) will be especially valued,  as will the processing of rgb-d images, knowledge of deep learning  techniques, and some experience in robot manipulation. _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_56&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=uxm1lab_jw0f-ww9otmpy6mtyyezp0lciiu6b5nrff8&s=8jn8qqukzjeabwie_lon9ea03r5kbbtwa6yfni139z4&e= _application deadline:_ 28/02/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --
