subject: 12 positions in aerial robotics for erc  advanced grant griffin and other h2020 projects
content: the robotics laboratory (grvc) at the university of seville ( spain ) has  opened *12 positions *for: ?new h2020 *erc advanced grant griffin* (principal investigator anibal  ollero) dealing with safe and long endurance flapping wing aerial robots  with perching and manipulation capabilities, ?the following new h2020 eu-funded projects also dealing with aerial  robotics: *hyfliers *on hybrid aerial-ground locomotion system for  inspection, *gauss* on safe operations with galileo-egnos, *safedrone*  on very low level operations with unmanned and manned aircrafts,  *resist* on applications to infrastructure inspections and *aerotwin *on  spreading excellence in aerial robotics *aerial robotics topics:*mechanical and mechatronic design, aerodynamic  modelling and control, aerial soft robotics and compliance, perception  and control for landing and manipulation, bioinspired perception and  control, motion planning with dynamic awareness,? collision detection  and avoidance, multi-robot systems,bayesian estimation and sensor  fusion, machine learning, slam and real-time perception systems, *we search:* - senior researcher positions with strong publication record, as well as  experience and solvency in managing robotic projects and work teams. - postdoc researcher positions with publication record and experience in  technically developing? projects. candidates should have experience in  the above topics, and in participating in complex r&d projects.  excellent english writing skills and capacity to prepare project  deliverables. - phd positions for motivated early stage researchers in aerial robotic  systems control/planning and perception. candidates must have master of  science degree and a strong background and/or interest in some of the  above aerial robotics topics. selected applicants should have team working skills, have good or  excellent english and scientific writing skills. should combine a strong  interest in scientific research with eagerness to transfer the  technology developed. *we offer:* - senior researcher position: contract with gross yearly amount to be  negotiated - postdoc: contract with gross yearly amount greater than 33.000 eur. - phd positions: contract, or scholarship including full social security  + bonus depending on performance, reaching up to 25,000 eur for all positions, the initial contract will be for a period of 1 year  and will start in the third quarter of 2018. this contract could be  extended for a total of 3 or 4 years (depending on the project), subject  to good performance. ** *the grvc laboratory:* the candidate will be integrated in the grvc laboratory  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__grvc.us.es&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sepkreobz-qcygqams_tm2exdweqfxay8xdc242rv98&s=yz5pd47fl10pqrtveayccvrnr2tfdaiszzpsyp4fsqu&e=), one of the most relevant laboratories in aerial  robotics. grvc is currently composed of more than 75 members with  heterogeneous and synergetic engineering background and skills  (aeronautics, mechatronics, computer science, telecommunication,  electronics, mechanical engineering) with long tradition in aerial  robotics, since 1998. in the last 10 years the grvc researchers have led  or participated in more than 75projects in aerial robotics, including 20  framework program european projects (leading 5) and receiving more than  21 million euros of external funding. currently, it is participating in  13 active h2020 projects. the grvc is at the school of engineering of seville  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.etsi.us.es_en&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sepkreobz-qcygqams_tm2exdweqfxay8xdc242rv98&s=vh7__hs-kfveexoszjh5unjtnbmv2kldik--7zkhi2e&e=). with more than 6.000 students and 19  engineering bs. and msc. degrees and 5 phd programs, it is one of the  largest engineering academic centres in europe. sevilla is a beautiful medium-sized city at the south of  spain  with  profound historical and cultural background and vibrant modern life  (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_seville&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sepkreobz-qcygqams_tm2exdweqfxay8xdc242rv98&s=cmcab7bhz_hl7ds5trpgy1dzkdord59b9jedjgsp0ti&e=). sevilla has good weather  conditions, it is close to beaches and environmentally protected areas,  has excellent gastronomy and is a relatively cheap city to live in. ** *how to apply:* please submit your application by sending an email  togrvc.candidates at gmail.com <mailto:grvc.candidates at gmail.com>with the  following information: 1) type of position (senior researcher, postdoc or phd.) and particular  aerial robotics topics (see list above) you are applying. 2) a motivation letter briefly describing the motivation of your  application: what do you consider the best facts in your cv? what are  your reasons to ask for the position? why would you like to work at the  grvc? 3) a detailed cv including a list of publications (if available). 4) if available: 1-3 english language documents describing your earlier  research (e.g., scientific papers, phd thesis, msc. thesis, project  report, etc.). these documents don?t need to be on the topic of the  position. 5) for phd positions: a transcript of your educational record (list of  courses per year, number of obtained credits, obtained marks). it does  not need to be an official document at this stage. a (rough) indication  or estimate of your rank among other students (e.g., top 10% among 35  students in my master). best regards. anibal ollero (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__grvc.us.es_aollero&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sepkreobz-qcygqams_tm2exdweqfxay8xdc242rv98&s=swmu2dwz3mvkqvpekcj5q13blibel-5d73jzumn6slq&e=)

subject: postdoc position on "task planning and  learning for robotized recycling tasks" at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: ==========================================================================================  1 postdocposition at iri, csic-upc,  spain  _application deadline: 15/07/2018_ ==========================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a highly motivated  applicant with a keen interest in doing research in automated planning  and cognitive science applied to real robotic problems. the postdoc will be supervised by dr. guillem aleny? and prof. carme  torras. about iri the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri),is a joint  university research institute participated by the spanish national  research council (csic) and the technical university of catalonia (upc)  that conducts research in human-centered robotics and automatic control.  the institute, is a key player in the spanish robotics and automatic  control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number of  international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, it has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about imagine project the position is linked to imagine  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_179&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=svkeaiaighzveas_vam6abkprjrzdyismc0h3zeqs_i&s=jlv5oi06u6yf6hzbr3yoyg4kf5cqqelsqkcs1kilwyq&e=>, a european project which  seeks to enable robots to understand the structure of their environment  and how it is affected by their actions. "understanding" here means the  ability of the robot (a) to determine the applicability of an action  along with parameters to achieve the desired effect, and (b) to discern  to what extent an action succeeded, and to infer possible causes of  failure and generate recovery actions. this scientific objective is  pursued in the context of recycling of electromechanical appliances. about the contract the postdoc will be incorporated into the perception and manipulation  group of iri. s/he will be hired through a 2-year postdoctoral contract  with a salary in the range of 27000 to 35000 ? gross per year, depending  on experience and skills. the incorporation will be take place as soon  as possible. requirements of the candidates the candidate can be of any nationality. s/he should be a doctor in  automated planning, preferably with experience in robotics. the  candidate should have strong skills in c++ programming and a good track  of publications in international journals and conferences of the area. _more info and how to appl__y__: _https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_63-5f-5f&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=svkeaiaighzveas_vam6abkprjrzdyismc0h3zeqs_i&s=jcenn2hmaawxcfmu8dzpmhwduhqadjjmm021vft5oiy&e= _application deadline:_ 15/07/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: multiple intership positions at wyca -  toulouse
content: about us ======= wyca robotics is a young startup located in the wonderful city of toulouse. we develop autonomous mobile robot to welcome, serve and guide clients, patients and visitors in real environment. keylo is our main product, a modular service robot which has been implemented in several stores and hospital of europe (including france,  spain , switzerland and germany) and usa. our main focus is on autonomous-navigation and intuitive api to integrate our robot in the client system. we have new exciting projects in the retail, security, healthcare, transportation, and inventory sector. we are looking for talented women and men passionated about robotics to helping us developing effective solutions to our customers needs. open internship subjects ==================== [1]    physical simulation of existing wyca robots for r&d, continuous integration and unit tests [2]    optimization of wyca robot deployment process: from mapping to fully functional robot [3]    hardware acceleration with intel igpu (through ffmpeg or better): from ros image     operations and usb webcam grabbing to 3d pointcloud/voxels navigation [4]    design, implementation and testing of unconventional localization methods for robot     navigation [5]    improvement of the hardware design and motor control of the current wyca robots. [6]    improve the human-robot-interaction of the wyca robots to improve the customer experience. your skills ======== -     last year of university studies (master or diplom-ingenieur) in the field of electrical/mecanical/control engineering or information technology or computer science. exceptional curriculum from different field might be considered. -     very good programming skills in c++/python; -     proven knowledge and extensive experience in at least one of the following areas: vision/lidar-based autonomous navigation, multi-modal sensor fusion, mobile robotics, person tracking/following; -     extensive experience in ros; -     mastery of linux; -     good knowledge of cooperative software development with git; -     excellent written and verbal communication skills in english; -     passionated about robotics. if you feel that you might fit with this description apply now! please send over your resume(in english), cover letter (in english), and the transcript of your academic transcript (with final marks) at guillaume.doisy at wyca.fr . in your application, do not forget to mention the number of the subject that interest you the most. for interns achieving outstanding results long term position will be considered at the end of the internship period. we are looking forward to hearing from you !

subject: multiple r&d positions at wyca -  toulouse
content: about us ======= wyca robotics is a young startup located in the wonderful city of toulouse. we develop autonomous mobile robot to welcome, serve and guide clients, patients and visitors in real environment. keylo is our main product, a modular service robot which has been implemented in several stores and hospital of europe (including france,  spain , switzerland and germany) and usa. our main focus is on autonomous-navigation and intuitive api to integrate our robot in the client system. we have new exciting projects in the retail, security, healthcare, transportation, and inventory sector. we are looking for talented women and men passionated about robotics to helping us developing effective solutions to our customers needs. your job at wyca ============== as member of the team you will be involved in the research and development activities related with our robotics platform. this include: -    writing efficient algorithms; -    deploy the robot on the customer site; -    perform tests and maintenance of our robots remotely; -    collaborate in the writing of research reports, scientific publications, and project proposal. your skills ======== -     good rated university degree (master or diplom-ingenieur) in the field of electrical/mecanical/control engineering or information technology or computer science. exceptional curriculum from different field might be considered. -     very good programming skills in c++/python; -     proven knowledge and extensive experience in at least one of the following areas: vision/lidar-based autonomous navigation, multi-modal sensor fusion, mobile robotics, person tracking/following; -     extensive experience in ros; -     mastery of linux; -     good knowledge of cooperative software development with git; -     excellent written and verbal communication skills in english; -     passionated about robotics. bonus points ========== ? phd in robotics; ? proficiency in opencv and pcl ? good understanding of gpus, opencl and cuda. ? knowledge of the principles of path planning and obstacle avoidance if you feel that you might fit with this description apply now! please send over your resume and cover letter (in english) at guillaume.doisy at wyca.fr . we are looking forward to hearing from you.

subject: 2 postdoc positions on "computational  topology/geometry applied to cloth representation and manipulation by  robots" at iri, csic-upc,  spain  in-reply-to: <06c3f022-c1d9-bc00-20da-82d7b9164339@iri.upc.edu> references: <06c3f022-c1d9-bc00-20da-82d7b9164339@iri.upc.edu>
content: ============================================================================================ 2 postdocpositions at iri, csic-upc,  spain  computational topology/geometry applied to cloth representation and  manipulation by robots (erc clothilde) _application deadline: 10/08/2018_ ============================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking two postdoc researchers to  work under the framework of the european project clothilde  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_187&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=haowxaxa8-apwdrdl2omzro0urzw6873wdqbyxak4eg&s=e3wy5tlvuidq1jkzxc3np6aw5rwtapntth5n2rx8g8i&e=> (erc advanced grant 2016). about iri: iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics  and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number  of international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about clothilde project: the european project clothilde (cloth manipulation learning from  demonstration) is an erc advanced grant, awarded to dr. carme torras,  that started in january 2018. the project aim is to establish the foundations of versatile cloth  manipulation by robots. the theoretical ground will be to link machine  learning and computational topology methods, so as to come up with a  theory of cloth deformation under manipulation leading to a general  framework for robots to learn to manipulate garments from human  demonstrations. such framework will encompass: non-expert teaching of a  task, robot perception and skill learning, task-oriented cloth  representation, probabilistic planning, robot task execution in varying  initial conditions, failure diagnosis and informed requests for human help. about the postdoc positions the clothilde project has been structured into four research  workpackages, plus one integration workpackage. the four packages are:  theory of cloth manipulation, cloth perception and representation,  probabilistic task and motion planning, and manipulation learning from  demonstration. these positions correspond to the theory of cloth manipulation  workpackage and its connection with cloth representation and motion  planning. the tasks to be carried out are: 1. research on combinatorial topology, computational geometry and tools 2. research on surface representations in computer graphics, especially  for clothing 3. encoding manipulation-relevant features in cloth representation 4. physical simulation of manipulation actions on clothing 5. topological/geometric characterization of manipulation actions about the contract the postdocs will be supervised by prof. carme torras and will be  incorporated into the perception and manipulation group of iri. both postdocs will be hired through a csic contract with a salary  depending on experience and skills, and their incorporation will take  place as soon as possible. the duration of the contracts will be of one year, extendible until the  end of the project (december 2022). requirements of the candidates the candidates can be of any nationality. they should be a doctor with a  solid mathematical and computer science background. the candidate should have experience in carrying out research in  geometry and computational/combinatorial topology, with application to  computer graphics, computer vision, robotics, or related areas. _more info and how to appl__y__:___https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_64&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=haowxaxa8-apwdrdl2omzro0urzw6873wdqbyxak4eg&s=5ywnlz0pbubb_lyp_syd0lyvaxn8urssi53intsrsyi&e= _application deadline:_ 10/08/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: phd student on "topological measures to  plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation" at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: ============================================================================================ 1 phd student position at iri, csic-upc,  spain  topological measures to plan flexible objects bimanual robotic manipulation _application deadline: 30/09/2018_ ============================================================================================  iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a phd student to work  under the framework of the european project clothilde  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_187&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0pluw8uigtex_yyoy7abllv5lpoifssmvzxhdpjliwe&s=v6amyikwhjvfsozx7b7q-xzfs5lt3v5wdi45uisat2g&e=>(erc advanced grant 2016). the phd will be supervised by dr. j?lia borr?s sol and prof. federico  thomas. about iri: iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics  and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number  of international collaborations including more than ten ongoing h2020  projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been recognized as  a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. about clothilde project: the european project clothilde (cloth manipulation learning from  demonstration) is an erc advanced grant, awarded to dr. carme torras,  that started in january 2018. the project aim is to establish the foundations of versatile cloth  manipulation by robots. the theoretical ground will be to link machine  learning and computational topology methods, so as to come up with a  theory of cloth deformation under manipulation leading to a general  framework for robots to learn to manipulate garments from human  demonstrations. such framework will encompass: non-expert teaching of a  task, robot perception and skill learning, task-oriented cloth  representation, probabilistic planning, robot task execution in varying  initial conditions, failure diagnosis and informed requests for human help. about the position textile manipulation is intrinsically bimanual and its main challenge is  how to predict the behaviour of completely shapeless objects when they  are manipulated, in order to be able to plan an action such as folding  or covering an object. we want to exploit different gripper designs that  allow us to conform desired shapes of the pieces of cloth that are being  manipulated in a way that is meaningful for different geometric  representations of the configuration state of a bimanual system of  grippers+cloth. the main idea behind this project will be to define new  representations in terms of points or oriented lines that allow us to  extract topological and shape information from each configuration of our  grippers+cloth system. in the long term, we want to plan motions between  different configurations exploiting optimization methods based on  topological and geometric indexes. to start, we will study the gauss linking integral [1], as an index that  measures the writhe between two open polygonal curves. this index has  been recently used to synthesize motions for humanoid robots [2],  grasping [3] and manipulation through holes in the environment [4]. we  will revisit the computation of the index, its geometric interpretation  and possible improvements, and in parallel we will explore the 2d  extension of this index, starting by studying the writhe matrix between  different significant curves on a 2d surface. [1] ricca, renzo l., and bernardo nipoti. "gauss'linking number  revisited." journal of knot theory and its ramifications 20.10 (2011):  1325-1343. [2] ho, edmond sl, and taku komura. "indexing and retrieving motions of  characters in close contact." ieee transactions on visualization &  computer graphics 3 (2008): 481-492. [3] zarubin, dmitry, et al. "topological synergies for grasp transfer."  hand synergies?how to tame the complexity of grapsing, workshop, ieee  international conference on robotics and automation (icra 2013),  karlsruhe, germany. citeseer. 2013. [4] ivan, vladimir, et al. "topology-based representations for motion  planning and generalization in dynamic environments with interactions."  the international journal of robotics research 32.9-10 (2013): 1151-1163. * *requirements of the candidates the candidates can be of any nationality. s/he is expected to have a  master in mathematics, computer science or a related field, and have interest in geometry and computational topology topics _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_65&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0pluw8uigtex_yyoy7abllv5lpoifssmvzxhdpjliwe&s=gfzn7uaa2qdkyjgngo9wrqo4z0biv2o8iudync8mwxy&e= _application deadline:_ 30/09/2018 **we are looking forward to receiving your application. thank you. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

subject: phd student research position at  ben-gurion university of the negev - older adults interaction with robots
content: 12-18 months ph.d. student research position in older adults' interaction with robots department of communication studies department of industrial engineering and management the center for multidisciplinary research in aging agricultural, biological, cognitive robotics initiative ben-gurion university of the negev ben-gurion university of the negev (bgu) is seeking outstanding candidates for a phd student position in older adults' interaction with robots, at the departments of communication studies and industrial engineering and management and the center for multidisciplinary research in aging. bgu is an internationally recognized research university that attracts outstanding faculty and researchers from around the world with over 19,000 students. the dept. of communication studies includes a multidisciplinary faculty with expertise in new media, audience research, cultural diversity and disadvantaged populations. the dept. of industrial engineering includes faculty experts in human factors and robotics. advanced innovative multidisciplinary robotics research at bgu is conducted under the auspices of the abc robotics initiative. socrates the recruitment is done as part of socrates (social cognitive robotic agents in the european society), a marie sk?odowska-curie european training network (etn) comprising 7 universities/research institutes: ume? university and ?rebro university in  sweden , universit?t hamburg and fraunhofer ipa, stuttgart in germany, csic barcelona in  spain , university west of england, and ben-gurion university of the negev in israel. additional non-academic partners are: pal robotics, adele robots, alfred nobel science park, urquhart-dykes & lord llp, center for digital innovation, uminova, asea brown boveri, s.a, and fundaci? ace. in total 15 early stage researchers (esrs) were recruited as phd students for research on various aspects of social robotics aiming at eldercare. the wide range of projects covers a spectrum from technical design of hardware and interaction methodology, to personalization, user studies, and robot ethics. the researchers receive training in both academic and entrepreneurial spirit and expertise, well suited for a career in both academy and industry. the training includes working on a research project related to older adults' interaction with robots, as well as courses, seminars, and workshops suited for the students' academic interests and progress. as part of the research project and time dependent, secondments at ?rebro university,  sweden  and/or at fraunhofer ipa, germany might be planned. an overview of the socrates project can be found at www.socrates-project.eu<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.socrates-2dproject.eu&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=lnrdb01nism5syhdqrtnn-87g78cf9xx3n2qlo8k6xg&e=>. about the position the successful applicant will receive a competitive salary for a period of 12 months' full time research, provided that expected study and research results are achieved. no teaching is expected. the salary will be based on the standard marie sk?odowska-curie early-stage researcher living and mobility allowances. starting date: asap. who can apply? 1.      excellent msc students, who already graduated their studies and interested in exploring the new and exciting field of human-robot interaction. 2.      phd students, who have not yet graduated and interested in extending their work by including a component on older adults. in this case, the students will still be formally registered in their current university, and the time spent at bgu will be considered as student exchange. admission requirements candidates should have interest in understanding aging and human-robot interaction (although should not necessarily have background in such topics), be able to work independently as well as in collaboration with others, and be passionate about learning and developing knowledge in a novel and exciting area. the applicant must be skilled in both oral and written communication in english. some background in social sciences and/or user studies is a significant advantage but not mandatory. once approved by bgu?s socrates graduate committee the student must obtain a visa and working permit according to the ministry of interior requirements. applicants aiming to pursue a phd must be accepted to bgu?s graduate school (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__in.bgu.ac.il_en_kreitman-5fschool_pages_admission.aspx&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=zotphf3g2bxlsbmif635xwh3fankqgvwyokz9rmt39e&e=). the phd candidate must submit a research proposal and go through a qualification exam within one year of studies on his/her research proposal. a phd at bgu is usually 4 years; for funding in the following years the student can apply for bgu scholarships and awards https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__in.bgu.ac.il_en_kreitman-5fschool_pages_scholarships-2dand-2dawards.aspx&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=tropb65rv4jpqw4froz5ctvley1ugijand-3arcu_yo&e=. to promote mobility, the following rule applies: at the time of recruitment, the applicants must not have resided or carried out their main activity in israel for more than 12 months during the last 3 years. compulsory national service, work in international organizations, and short stays such as holidays are not taken into account. the applicants must not, at the time of recruitment, have spent more than 4 years doing research, and must not have been awarded a doctoral degree. application a complete application should contain the following documents: ?        a cover letter including a description of your research interests, your reasons to apply for the position, and your contact information. ?        a curriculum vita. ?        copies of degree certificates, including documentation of completed academic courses and grades. ?        copy of completed ma/msc thesis and other original research publications. ?        contact information for three persons willing to act as references (including your ma/msc thesis advisor). applications must be submitted electronically to the following email by november 30, 2018. socrates at post.bgu.ac.il<mailto:socrates at post.bgu.ac.il> applications will be accepted until the position is filled. for additional information about the position, please contact: prof. galit nimrod - gnimrod at bgu.ac.il<mailto:gnimrod at bgu.ac.il>                                                                                                                    prof. yael edan - yael at bgu.ac.il for general information about the socrates project, please contact prof. thomas hellstr?m ?                                                                                                                                                      thomash at cs.umu.se www.socrates-project.eu<file:///d:\socrates\call%204%20students\www.socrates-project.eu> www.bgu.ac.il<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=fi6nwdmtqwvntykzicylbcugrb3hryxqglfe6dkambg&e=> www.bgu.ac.il/abc-robotics<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.bgu.ac.il_abc-2drobotics&d=dwif_w&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dxxvsbxw1kz_ztwtdcydmis94rcwq0lqp1thj1c6crc&s=nqmiicsvbxsprmgfsy7hnmmg_vrtaytcxzqj3kfejsi&e=>

subject: call for a postdoctoral researcher in  the area of robotic manipulation of deformable object
content: dear colleagues,we are seeking a postdoc to join the automation, robotics and artificial vision group ( aurova <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.aurova.ua.es_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dv7p4mwder4erxxtrpgqf321emjgta5dybrvlac39vc&s=pojomcifjnqhhqrndji3svlzgfkmf1quaaxnmplfd9c&e=>  ) of the computer science research institute (iuii) of the university of alicante,  spain . at aurova, we work on intelligent robotic systems, focused on grasping and manipulation, tactile perception, visual recognition and control for robots in real-world environments.the postdoctoral researcher will have an active role to carry out research within the european project named  commandia <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__http-3a__commandia.unizar.es_es_lo-2dbasico-2dde-2dcommandia_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dv7p4mwder4erxxtrpgqf321emjgta5dybrvlac39vc&s=vzgdixpk9akomurpvefkaexfgk6jolklm1_oxwmzmpq&e=>   (collaborative robotic mobile manipulation of deformable objects in industrial applications) supported by the interreg sudoe programme, which is financed by the european regional development fund (erdf). the postdoctoral researcher will work in collaboration with other european universities. the postdoctoral researcher will work developing new techniques of robotic perception (visual and tactile/force) and applying others from the state of the art to perform grasping and robotic manipulation of deformable objects. the goal is to use multi-modal data in order to control robotic manipulation tasks for dynamically handling deformable objects. the postdoctoral position is funded by the commandia project and it has a fixed duration of 18 months (expandable 6 months, up to 24 months). we are looking for a highly motivated and outstanding candidate with the following requirements:*requirements:*- phd/dphil (or near completion) in robotics, computer science, engineering, machine learning, artificial intelligence, control, or closely related field- excellent academic track record in topics relevant to computer vision; tactile perception, machine learning, artificial intelligence and robot control or related areas. - good programming skills (preferably experience using c/c++ and python) - good communication skills in english language (spanish is also valuable but it is not essential)*desirable:*-experience with rgbd cameras working in dynamic environments (real sense, kinetic, ?)-programming skills on ros (robot operating system) -experience with real robots (preferably industrial manipulators with grippers or multi-fingered hands)-a good understanding of control aspects and its application in matlab-knowledge of computer vision and machine learning libraries for programming (opencv, pcl, tensorflow or others)- publications record showing evidence of strong expertise in one or more of the following fields: computer vision, robotic perception, robotic manipulation and robot control, or relevant industrial experience.*during the post-doc position, the researcher will be mainly involved in:*-analysing the behaviour of objects and surfaces and its interaction with gripper and hand robots to detect and track deformations.- developing multi-modal control strategies and algorithms to carry out the robotic manipulation of deformable objects*type of contract and salary conditions:*-start date and workplace: the contract is expected to start in march or april 2019. the activities will be developed at university of alicante (alicante,  spain ) and/or other necessary locations to their execution.-the post-doc researcher position has a duration of 18 months (further extension may be possible up to 24months).-monthly remuneration: gross annual remuneration is approximately 28.000?/year, in accordance with the position of post-doc researcher, approved by order cg 29/05/2013. -the contract includes health care services from spanish national health service.*application process:*to apply, please send your cv, cover letter and at least one reference to /pablo.gil at ua.es/ and /fernando.torres at ua.es/. it is important to include in the email:1.	detailed cv in english or spanish.2.	phd certificate3.	a list of research publications in journals, conference, chapters, etc.4.	a motivation letter in english or spanish. it is recommendable one or two contact references.deadline for applications is:  8 january 2019*about alicante:*alicante is located at the southeast coast in  spain . it is famous for its great weather and beaches on the mediterranean coast. alicante is a touristic city which is well-known for the gastronomy as the famous dish ?paella?. it has both high-speed train and flights connecting with the three largest cities in  spain  (madrid, barcelona and valencia). in addition, it has the fifth-busiest airport in  spain  based on number of passengers with good connections to other european countries.  spain  is the country with the highest life expectancy in the european union according to a document of oecd (organisation for economic co-operation and development) in november 2017 and the second in the world. recently, the english newspaper  the guardian <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.theguardian.com_world_2018_oct_19_spaniards-2dliving-2dlonger-2dresearchers-2dcredit-2ddiet-2dlifestyle-2dfruit-2dveg-2dfamily-2dlife&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dv7p4mwder4erxxtrpgqf321emjgta5dybrvlac39vc&s=nituilfksky9u3vnrqd9akb7lv437zr42ojpekdbyei&e=>   said that  spain  is on course to become home of the world's longest-lived people, with researchers crediting diet and lifestyle.the life in alicante is not expensive. the spanish average annual salary is 22.793?/year in 2017, being in the region 20.197?/year. besides, the spanish national health system obtains 92 points of 100 (position 19/195) and it is among the best systems in the world according to the opinion of  lancet journal <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__doi.org_10.1016_s0140-2d6736-2818-2930994-2d2&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dv7p4mwder4erxxtrpgqf321emjgta5dybrvlac39vc&s=6w-3ae6eof9zyincyin-ald0idojxzdeepez_ytyqqs&e=>  . -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=dv7p4mwder4erxxtrpgqf321emjgta5dybrvlac39vc&s=s3xvlfc4pmkvk08cyxhgqst7r6lzoocrhdowu9gbghm&e=

subject: opening positions at aisoy robotics,   spain
content: we are hiring! ready to become part of the emotional robotics revolution? we always look for talented, passionate and creative people to join our team.  current openings: - devops: systems administrator with knowledge in linux, servers, docker, ci/cd, web sockets, data base, security.  - robotics software engineer: experience in robotics, ros, raspberry pi, arduino.  - computer science engineer: experience in programming (c++, python), architecture software patterns, linux, networking, cloud computing - ios & android developer: qt and/or unity experience are welcome.  if you are interested and want more information please contact us at: info at aisoy.com

subject: research engineer positions on internet  of things and social robots at isr-univ. coimbra
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) ------------------------------------------------------------------- two research engineer positions at isr - univ. of coimbra,  portugal  topics: internet of things, social robots, smart homes, ambient assisted living, active and healthy ageing application deadline: january 2, 2019 ------------------------------------------------------------------- description of the opportunity   two research engineer positions are available at institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.isr.uc.pt_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=vtfnnd_r8gf0x0hp656bwmsg_v6qnzlo3gw5towzzqs&e=),  portugal , under the supervision of prof. rui p. rocha, in the scope of the project ?euroage - innovative initiatives for the promotion of active aging in the euroace region?, with the ref. poctep-0043_euroage_4_e, funded by the interreg v a  spain  -  portugal  program (poctep 2014-2020). the euroage project aims at fostering autonomous healthy life, mainly in elderly people but also in people with some degree of dependency, through the promotion of innovative initiatives based on information and communication technologies provided by the patterns participating in the project. the project involves  portugal - spain  cross-border cooperation of partners from euroace region, a region that covers centro and alentejo regions in  portugal , and extremadura region in  spain , which is a territory in iberian peninsula heavily affected by the ageing of the population. the research team from isr - university of coimbra that participates in the euroage project has been demonstrating and validating with elderly people the use of social robots, internet of things, and smart homes as key technologies to promote active and healthy ageing, through cognitive, socio-emotional stimulation and physical activity promotion, thus contributing to quality of life enhancement and increased healthy life expectancy, mainly in the elderly population. the following video illustrates the team?s recent developments: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cloud.isr.uc.pt_index.php_s_wgq5od0fblmxnsq_download&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=xxjb-tg6gjqypovqzcrsdrf7bk3ynawfekcwwp8h0kc&e= application requirements   the eligible candidates must hold a **m.sc. degree in electrical and computer engineering, or in computer science obtained in a university located in a country that is a member of the european higher education area (i.e. in a country that ratified the bolonha process)**, and must have **nationality from a country belonging to the schengen area, or hold a passport containing a travel visa to remain or live in a country belonging to the schengen area**. the candidates must have high oral and written proficiency in english if her/his mother tongue is not the portuguese. profile of prospective candidates  the ideal candidate would have: excellent software development skills in c++, python and linux os; solid experience in software development for mobile robots using ros (robot operating system); experience in protocols for devices used in internet of things, and/or computer vision, and/or human-robot interaction; excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills; and high motivation to get involved in the euroage project. application procedure applicants must send by email the following mandatory documents: i) digital copy of the m.sc. academic degree certificate; ii) curriculum vitae (cv), including gpa for academic degrees, curricula of the b.sc. and m.sc. courses, and title of the m.sc. dissertation; iii) motivation letter ? the candidate must demonstrate that she/he fulfills all the application requirements and possesses a suitable professional and research profile for the position. **important notice**: candidates who did not obtain their m.sc. degree in  portugal  are obliged to present records of the equivalence/recognition of the m.sc. diploma in  portugal , issued by the directorate-general for higher education or by a portuguese public higher education establishment, according with the information at:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.uc.pt_en_academicos_provas_equivalencia&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=jaztaq_0yakvwnhvoqmulkdsfbofbwag_ztr08z7ygw&e= for candidates who are still waiting for the end of this recognition process, at least a proof that a request for the diploma recognition is being processed by the academic services of university of coimbra (e.g. an email from official services) must be included in the application. the following optional documents can be sent together with the aforementioned documents: - certificates of the participation in face-to-face courses, workshops, and summer schools related with ros, mobile robotics, iot, computer vision, or human-robot interaction; - reference letters and contact information of current or previous supervisors for candidates having past experience in r&d projects; - other relevant documentation, e.g. a digital copy of the m.sc. dissertation. since the applicants having the best curriculum will be interviewed in mid-january 2019 before the winning candidates are selected, every applicant should provide the skype nickname in the contact information included in the cv. the application must be sent in pdf format to rprocha[at]deec.uc.pt, with the subject ?research engineer positions in euroage project?, **no later than january 2, 2019**. ______ rui p. rocha, ph.d. assistant professor institute of systems and robotics dept. of electrical and computer engineering university of coimbra universidade de coimbra - p?lo ii 3030-290 coimbra,  portugal  e-mail: rprocha[at]deec.uc.tel.: +351 239 796 256 skype: rprocha web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__home.deec.uc.pt_-7erprocha&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=9dws7gahsnz5sxtz34xds8hhovwrsha3aojgbvtk-da&e= _______ founded in 1290, the university of coimbra (uc) is the oldest portuguese university and one of the oldest in the world. uc is nowadays a vibrant academy and an indisputable reference in higher education and research in  portugal  and in europe, due to the quality of the courses taught at its eight faculties and to its excellence in the promotion of science and technology advances in 46 research units integrated in the university. with more than 1,500 researchers and professors, uc has extensive experience in research programs with competitive research funding, particularly in european commission (ec) framework programs for research, in several areas including sciences, engineering, health, justice and home affairs, international cooperation, and mobility. in fp7, uc participated in 59 projects and was the coordinator in 10 of them. since the beginning of h2020, uc has participated in 20 project applications that were approved for funding, being the coordinator in 5 of them. the institute of systems and robotics - university of coimbra (isr-uc) is a research unit integrated in uc whose overall goal is to develop excellent research in various areas of science and technology, with emphasis on intelligent systems and robotics. the isr-uc has participated in over a dozen european projects funded by ec framework programmes, e.g. projects bacs and irps in fp6, projects prometheus, handle, and social robot in fp7, and project growmeup in h2020.  portugal  is a member of the european union and is an excellent place to study and do research. discover why at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__study-2dresearch.pt&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rstc00sfv_qvwqlcnmghkrrotmim5rlso-ftzvw2nfnyo&m=6h-mdk8kpm26szmgjb8gwaipglfh2w7-yxmnck8dzso&s=4lmvciohv-1yejhoiuuaj9zgwrt2qb9yikc8k4oqgu0&e= .

subject: postdoc position "gnss/galileo systems  development for aerial robotics", at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: *==========================================================================================  ** **1 postdoc***position* at iri, csic-upc,  spain  * _application deadline: 18/01/2019_ *==========================================================================================  * the "institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc, is  seeking a postdoctoral researcher to work in the area of of*gnss/galileo  systems development for aerial robotics*, under the framework of the european project gauss  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_198&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yjd_b1qrdacia2xkbfwb_jow_0xlzvofnegbgvp1gwm&s=no3z2pwsk7w8j2nmh68osroh5b4a-mo1ls5umewsaay&e=>. *about iri:* iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute, is a key player in the spanish  robotics and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a  large number of international collaborations including more than ten  ongoing h2020 projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been  recognized as a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation  given by the spanish government to research units that stand out for the  impact and international relevance of their results. *about the postdoc **position* the applicant will be involved in the eu project gauss, with the main  task of developing a state of the art gnss positioning solution for  civil uav applications. the postdoc will be supervised by dr. juan andrade and will be  incorporated into the mobile robotics group of iri. she/he will be hired  through a csic contract and her/his incorporation will take place in  march 2018 or earliest possible. the duration of the contract will be of  one year, extendable until two more years according to performance. *requirements of the candidates* applicants should have a phd in robotics, telecommunications  engineering, systems engineering or informatics, and a proven track  record of high quality publications. a strong experience in design,  prototyping, and experimental testing in robotics and/or data fusion for  gnss systems for uav systems is required. the capability to work in  collaboration with a multidisciplinary team including engineers,  master?s and phd students is required. the postdoctoral fellow will be  expected to publish scholarly papers and take mentorship role for  undergraduate and graduate students. strong organisational skills are  required, as well as excellent written and oral communication skills in  english. _more info and how to appl__y__: _ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_72&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yjd_b1qrdacia2xkbfwb_jow_0xlzvofnegbgvp1gwm&s=s9gffbomxby2l1b2y5lzha3qwuza10uagjg8yzzmkam&e= _application deadline:_ 18/01/2019 we are looking forward to receiving your application. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

*==========================================================================================  * the "institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc, is  seeking a postdoctoral researcher to work in the area of of*gnss/galileo  systems development for aerial robotics*, under the framework of the european project gauss  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_project_show_198&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-lzapx9qnbu3hmprsgnh-wtjaih4awm-mm5o5pyck8k&s=k9xasoy84i3lwqhalco9b1urgikymudn2j6sjs5umgi&e=>. *about iri:* iri is a joint university research institute participated by the spanish  national research council (csic) and the technical university of  catalonia (upc) that conducts research in human-centered robotics and  automatic control. the institute, is a key player in the spanish  robotics and automatic control scenes, and a valued participant in a  large number of international collaborations including more than ten  ongoing h2020 projects and an erc advanced grant. recently, is has been  recognized as a maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation  given by the spanish government to research units that stand out for the  impact and international relevance of their results. *about the postdoc **position* the applicant will be involved in the eu project gauss, with the main  task of developing a state of the art gnss positioning solution for  civil uav applications. the postdoc will be supervised by dr. juan andrade and will be  incorporated into the mobile robotics group of iri. she/he will be hired  through a csic contract and her/his incorporation will take place in  march 2018 or earliest possible. the duration of the contract will be of  one year, extendable until two more years according to performance. *requirements of the candidates* applicants should have a phd in robotics, telecommunications  engineering, systems engineering or informatics, and a proven track  record of high quality publications. a strong experience in design,  prototyping, and experimental testing in robotics and/or data fusion for  gnss systems for uav systems is required. the capability to work in  collaboration with a multidisciplinary team including engineers,  master?s and phd students is required. the postdoctoral fellow will be  expected to publish scholarly papers and take mentorship role for  undergraduate and graduate students. strong organisational skills are  required, as well as excellent written and oral communication skills in  english. _more info and how to appl__y__: _ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_72&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=-lzapx9qnbu3hmprsgnh-wtjaih4awm-mm5o5pyck8k&s=gvhztshvp4ic9sorcmly4cket1kz-z2uisvrqwxdu9u&e= 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --

the universidad loyola andaluc?a (www.uloyola.es) is looking for candidates to cover 2 phd scholarships in the department of engineering to do the phd within the following projects:   1.  control of autonomous surface vehicles fleets for water quality monitoring.   2.  distributed estimation and control in cyber-physicals systems with applications to smart agriculture. what we offer:   1.  the possibility to study in a dynamic research team in close cooperation with industries and advanced universities the world over.   2.  work and study in sevilla, one of the world's most appealing cities.   3.  one-year contract (renewable for 2 years more) to complete the doctoral thesis.   4.  possibility of developing teaching competences as teaching assistant eligibility: the candidates must have basic elegibility in accordance with the following requirements   1.  engineering or computer science studies   2.  english level at least b2 selection: in the selection of applicants, the following will be assessed:   1.  ability to independently pursue his or hers work   2.  teamwork ability/collaborative profile   3.  high motivation   4.  work with complex issues   5.  academic record applications must be sent to: rrhh at uloyola.es, and pmillan at uloyola.es including cv, application letter, and a recommendation letter(s).

subject: marie curie - phd position in medical  robotics: distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (kul  sssa)
content: we are looking for highly motivated candidates to fill in a phd position on: *distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (esr3)* the interaction between flexible instrument bodies and surrounding  deformable lumens is intrinsically complex and hard to oversee if not  explicitly measured. esr3 identifies and integrates optimal sensing  technology for real-time proprioception along the deformable body. this project includes real time shape estimation based on optical  measurements such as fbgs or relying on electromagnetic (em) tracking.  it explores new sensing methods such as electrical impedance tomography  (eit) or algorithms that estimate the contact location and amplitude of  the interaction force based on the acquired shape estimates. automatic  calibration and registration techniques will be developed, so that  resulting techniques may be employed ?out of the box? requiring minimal  effort and tuning prior to deployment. (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_vacancies_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=jnkfhv9gau2ogsies_b6mm4kvknsakfg303vtd_xtla&e=) the ph.d. is part of the marie curie innovative training network atlas. the ph.d. will be hosted by - ku leuven, belgium (primary institution) - scuola superiore sant'anna, pisa italy. atlas (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=exnpyw2nkljqhixgbsd56-yhar8sn08mhfa6nodgul4&e=) is a marie curie itn-ejd project  (innovative training network ? european joint doctorate, ga no 813782)  that targets the training of experts in a very specific branch of  robotic surgery. within this scheme, 15 ph.d. positions are funded. the consortium is formed by - ku leuven - belgium - tu delft  - the netherlands - universit? de strasbourg - france - politecnico di milano - italy - universit? di verona - italy - scuola superiore sant?anna ? italy (pisa) - universitat polit?cnica de catalunya ?  spain  (barcellona) upon successful completion, each ph.d. candidate will be awarded a  double ph.d. degree. more information on how to apply can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_recruitment-2dprocedure_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=omyp6v44qu1zkk9-8eoqbbhw4wtqj_idehjb5ihypoa&e= envisioned closing date for application submission is 7th of march. --  ------------------------------------------------ gianni borghesan, phd robot assisted surgery group robotics research group ku leuven, department of mechanical engineering, division of pma room 04.214 celestijnenlaan 300b, b-3001 heverlee, belgium. tel: +32 163 29267 ------------------------------------------------

subject: senior autonomous navigation engineer  at pal robotics - barcelona,  spain
content: company description pal robotics is a robotics company developing humanoid and mobile service robots. our goal is to develop robots that can perform useful tasks in the real world. we are a young and multidisciplinary team of highly motivated engineers, that have successfully developed several prototypes. job description pal robotics is looking for a highly motivated research engineer in the area of slam and autonomous navigation. the selected individual will be part of the team responsible for developing, integrating and maintaining the autonomous navigation system on pal robotics robots both with wheels and legs. the robots are going to work in real environments and for this reason safety, robustness, fault detection and recovery should be taken into account during the project design and implementation process. primary duties:    - maintenance of the current pal robotics navigation system    - long term navigation strategy development    - autonomous localization in indoor environment with multiple sensors:    laser, cameras, wifi    - path planning and motion control with obstacle avoidance    - slam extension for multi-floor and multi-robot application    - low-cost navigation solution development (rgb-d or camera)    - code qa through unit tests further duties:    - functional testing on simulation environment    - stress test in real environments    - availability to travel for pilots and poc mandatory requirements    - master?s degree in computer science/ control / ai    - at least 2 years c++ experience    - knowledge about slam algorithms    - good knowledge of ros and the ros navigation stack    - proactive team working attitude    - good communication skills (at least in english) desired requirements    - experience with real robotic hardware    - experience with revision control systems (git)    - experience installing and configuring ubuntu or any other linux    distribution.    - experience with 3d robotics simulation (gazebo)    - python knowledge job conditions    - the team is located in barcelona,  spain .    - flexible working hours contact details if you?re interested, please apply here <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.smartrecruiters.com_palrobotics_743999682287276-2dsenior-2dautonomous-2dnavigation-2dengineer&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ufolz9dlau8_8od9yemffzb5yo54fkax1iijcgwoey4&s=zu9jebwjo6-hc1vz3vgf94tavuxttlpqvnj6gt1yws0&e=> .

subject: biped locomotion engineer & electronics  engineer @ pal robotics
content: pal robotics is a leading robotics company based in sunny barcelona. our mission is to enhance people?s quality of life through robotics and automation technologies. our goal is to develop humanoids that can perform useful tasks in the real world. we are a young and multidisciplinary team of highly motivated engineers, we have over 14 years of experience in the robotics field and offer daily challenges to everyone in our team to help them grow. *robot locomotion engineer*for this position we are seeking a robotics engineer with experience in developing walking control algorithms for humanoid robots. we require a solid background in legged locomotion control with a significant experience in modeling and solving optimization problems. the applicant must be capable of developing custom optimization methods to solve locomotion and multi-contact problems. we also require a solid understanding of multi-body dynamics and experience implementing controllers in real torque controlled robots. this work will require to conceptualize, implement and debug the algorithms in one of the most advanced humanoid robots in the world, talos, a fully torque controlled biped robot. *primary duties*    - developing walking control algorithms.    - developing whole body control algorithms.    - developing multi-contact motion planning algorithms.    - code qa through unit tests. *required skills*    - phd or ms degree in robotics with emphasis in robot locomotion and    optimization.    - excellent c++ programming skills.    - programming for real-time control and sensor processing.    - experience developing in linux os.    - proactive team working attitude.    - excellent spoken and written english.    - experience with real robotic hardware. *desired skills*    - knowledge of ros.    - dynamic simulation.    - state estimation.    - experience with revision control systems (git). apply in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__smrtr.io_34zxq&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=acqp5k0o-uscqjsgpc6ppxgb9-xgr5luazetni5mkew&s=hosruclbyxzrha3cxb_js_8evseujovmgb3ffg6dgmo&e= *senior electrical engineer* pal robotics is seeking a talented and motivated electrical engineer to work on system design, implementation and release to manufacturing. the ideal candidate will have experience in system design, analog and digital circuit design, possess good communication skills, and have the ability to help build a team of electrical engineers. this candidate must have the ability to work well both independently and in team settings. *duties and responsibilities*    - analysis of requirements, conceptualization and development of    electronic circuits with microcontrollers and peripheral components for    ad/da conversion, sensor technology/electrical actuators, bus interfaces    etc.    - design hardware, source components, develop schematics, manage layout,    and test prototypes to validate hardware.    - supporting product releases to manufacturing and customer deployments.    - provide technical support to other departments as required for solving    technical issues and meet project requirements.    - define specifications, generate project documentation and reports. *required skills*    - ms in electrical engineering or other related engineering discipline.    - 5-10 years? experience in the consumer electronics, robotics,    industrial production, or other mechatronics industry as an electrical    engineer.    - recent, product-focused experience designing multilayered boards    including actual hands-on board layout, bring-up, and debug experience.    - familiarity with a broad range of electronic components and hardware,    including analog, power, fpgas, microcontrollers, memories, logic, signal    conditioning, and communication interfaces.    - strong background on bldc motor control drivers, can and ethercat     buses.    - proven experience with emi/emc compliance challenges, design for    reliability, and design for manufacturability.    - experienced altium designer user.    - good c/c++ programming skills. *desired skills and experience*    - complex multi-axis control system architecture development: power,    communication (can, ethernet, ethercat), safety.    - multi-axis robot system integration.    - able to perform and understand spice analysis with proficiency.    - graphical interface development with qt library.    - experience dealing with providers and manufacturing workshops.    - experience working with erp systems. apply in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__smrtr.io_-2d-5fyx&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=acqp5k0o-uscqjsgpc6ppxgb9-xgr5luazetni5mkew&s=omqm-_ip7zyv57timz4tmyicwtpkbnozybz-rmfcgfq&e= *job conditions*    - the company is located in barcelona,  spain .    - start date: immediate.    - the compensation package will be evaluated according to the relevant    experience of the candidate.    - all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo    guidelines. --  hilario tome robotics engineer hilario.tome at pal-robotics.com www.pal-robotics.com pal robotics, s.l. c/ pujades 77-79, 4?4? 08005 barcelona  spain  tel      +34 93 414 53 47 fax     +34 93 209 11 09 skype:  hilariotome.pal-robotics facebook <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.facebook.com_palrobotics1&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=acqp5k0o-uscqjsgpc6ppxgb9-xgr5luazetni5mkew&s=jnaypf0zeolgew5bpzoc1_rtwlqieya6i6sx-vbiube&e=> - twitter <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__twitter.com_-23-2521_palrobotics&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=acqp5k0o-uscqjsgpc6ppxgb9-xgr5luazetni5mkew&s=tzbnw2gurouck7rokmcbsznyqn21rejttnrsslwbi6k&e=> - subject: several research/engineer opportunities  at eurecat technology center (barcelona)
content: dear colleagues, the autonomous systems group of eurecat technology center is offering several opportunities for highly motivated researchers to join our group in barcelona. as a technology center, we are located between academia and industry: applying robotics research to continuously innovate and help our partners and clients. a great opportunity to develop robotics technology and applications working in national and h2020 research projects or hand by hand with our customers in several of our private contracts with industry. we are a team of energetic young people passionate about robotics. come join us! the main responsibilities include the scientific contribution, technological development and support to two of our research lines: orobust localization and navigation (i.e. ekf, particle filters, slam, graph-slam, solvers, special planners, reinforcement learning, etc) o3d robotics and artificial intelligence (i.e. 3d perception, object recognition, deep slam, semantic navigation, etc ) oother specializations and backgrounds may be considered to complement our robotics team. the candidates will work with different type of mobile robots in logistics, advanced manufacturing and in field applications (construction, agriculture, etc), as well as, autonomous drones (mavs) in complex inspection and monitoring tasks. required skills ============ ophd or msc plus equivalent experience in robotics/computer vision or related discipline. oscientific background in at least one of the following areas of robotics: slam and localization methods, path planning, vision-based robotics, 3d perception, and artificial intelligence/deep learning. oknowledge about ros (robot operating system) and good programming skills (c++ mostly), oknowledge on the following would be evaluated: algorithm and data structures, reusable code, python, pytorch and/or tensorflow, unit testing, and software documentation. oteam spirit and ability to work independently. oexcellent communication skills, flexibility, and creativity. oexcellent knowledge of english is required. oexperience with robotics mechanics and electronics would be considered relevant as well. application procedure =================== send the cv and motivation letter as a single pdf by email to daniel.serrano at eurecat.org . in the subject, use "2019-01-slam" if you apply for the first vacancy, "2019-01-3drobai" if you apply for the second one or "2019-01-general" if you consider your application relevant and it does not fit either of them. internship positions are also available under request ("2019-01-intern"). the job positions are available immediately and are on a permanent basis. salary to be negotiated. three-step selection process: 1) initial informal phone call, 2) technical interview, 3) detailed interview (involving hhrr) deadline: 10/05/2019 (send it anyway after this date but we will proceed to interview others at this point at the latest) what eurecat can offer you ======================= eurecat, technology centre brings together the expertise of 600 professionals and serves more than a thousand companies. applied r + d, technological services, highly technoscientific training, technology consulting and professional events are some of the services that eurecat offers for companies of all sectors. the autonomous systems group is specialized in research and development on ground, aerial and industrial robotics. with a strong focus on our customers and partners needs, our mission is to enhance the capabilities and reliability of autonomous systems operating in realistic scenarios, improving the existing technology and enabling new applications. for over 10 years, the group has been involved in several of the most successful european projects in robotics. these are the links of our current and previous publicly available robotics projects: ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/logimatic/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/geomove/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/aerial-robot-for-sewer-inspection/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/built2spec-2/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/nature4cities/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/grape/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/maic/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/icarus/ ohttps://eurecat.org/en/portfolio-items/bots2rec/ ohttps://eurecat.org/es/portfolio-items/mood2be/ ohttps://eurecat.org/es/portfolio-items/sharework/ ohttp://www.assets4rail.eu/ our laboratory is located in cerdanyola del vall?s, in the outskirts of barcelona city ( spain ). barcelona besides being easily connected to the rest of europe, provides a great quality of life and a great robotics ecosystem full of initiatives, research groups, robotics companies and interesting events. and many more to come! daniel serrano head of autonomous systems | robotics and automation unit +34 935 944 700   |  +34 667 531 938 |   daniel.serrano at eurecat.org  av. universitat aut?noma, 23, 08290 cerdanyola del vall?s, barcelona www.eurecat.org @eurecat_news ________________________________ el destinatari d'aquest missatge no consent la utilitzaci? del correu electr?nic via internet i la gravaci? de missatges, li preguem que ens ho comuniqui immediatament. disclaimer: este mensaje puede subject: postdoc position at iri, csic-upc,  spain
content: *==========================================================================================  ** **1 postdoc***position* at iri, csic-upc,  spain  * _application deadline: 31/05/2019_ *==========================================================================================  * iri, csic-upc in barcelona,  spain , is seeking a postdoctoral researcher  to work under the framework of the "mar?a de maeztu (mdm)" unit of  excellence seal. in particular, the topic of the postdoc position is "*linking perception  and manipulation of non-rigid objects through deep learning*" *about iri* the institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), is a joint  university research institute participated by the spanish national  research council (csic) and the technical university of catalonia (upc).  the institute is a key player in the spanish robotics and automatic  control scenes, and a valued participant in a large number of  international collaborations . recently, it has been recognized as a  maria de maeztu excellence unit, the main accreditation given by the  spanish government to research units that stand out for the impact and  international relevance of their results. *about the postdoc **project* the goal of this project is to develop novel deep learning techniques to  capture the geometry of dressed persons from a single rgb image. current  approaches to reconstruct human shape consider low rank parametric  models that can only reconstruct the shape of the naked body of very  tight clothes. we will investigate different representations of the 3d  geometry to train deep networks and capture both the geometry of the  clothes and the underlying shape of the body. the candidate will be supervised by dr. francesc moreno  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_fmoreno_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovydvrrtaagw0qrlpljbcypejnikdauj4v9dwqwxdwa&s=sz5jauwn2urmcjx1gmnzc7turdqzczimxiudkrt7gb4&e=> and prof. carme torras  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_people_torras_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovydvrrtaagw0qrlpljbcypejnikdauj4v9dwqwxdwa&s=z8ezt41utrofkr7zkmrl6r0u7wcch0isjsx-t47hqx4&e=>, and she/he will work in  cooperation with the members of the perception and manipulation group at  iri. the candidate is expected to have good prior knowledge in deep  learning libraries, preferably pytorch. ** *about the position * a one-year postdoc position under the mdm strategic research programme  will be fully covered starting as soon as possible. the salary will be  around 36000 ? gross per year. in addition, 5500 ? per year will be  available for research expenses of the postdoc (travels, registrations,  equipment, training, etc). *requirements of the candidates* the candidate can be of any nationality. she/he should be a doctor with  a solid mathematical and computer science background. the candidate  should have experience in carrying out research in computer vision and  machine learning. it is mandatory to have a solid background in deep  learning. _more info and how to appl__y__:_ https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iri.upc.edu_jobs_74&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ovydvrrtaagw0qrlpljbcypejnikdauj4v9dwqwxdwa&s=o96vgxsbopbokzj_jd4jedbrydrny-sniobf8mo9eei&e= _application deadline:_ 31/05/2019 we are looking forward to receiving your application. best regards, --  institut de rob?tica i inform?tica industrial (iri), csic-upc tel: +34 93 401 57 83, fax: +34 93 401 57 50 @iri_robotics --
